description: Erection of single storey side extension to create new office space
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the plans and details shown in the application as listed below, unless variations are agreed by the Local Planning Authority in order to discharge other conditions attached to this decision:Reason:  For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

This application cannot be accepted as exempt from fee as the previous application has not been determined, withdrawn or appealed. The outstanding fee for this application is £3696. Please advise how you would like to move forward.

The materials and finishes of the external walls and roof of the development hereby permitted shall match in colour and texture those of the existing building and shall thereafter be retained as such. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (Or any provisions equivalent to that Class on any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order), the development shall not be used for any use other than as an Office, Class B1 (a).Reason: To avoid the introduction of other uses in the same Use Class, which may be harmful to the amenities of the area and with regard to Policies DM10 and DM18 of the Kingston Core Strategy (adopted April 2012).

The Office shall not be used for the purposes hereby permitted before 8:00am; or after 18:00; Monday to Friday or before 09:00 or after 13:00 on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes or for access to the first floor residential flat at No. 15a High Street New Malden.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The fee required for your planning application is £96.00. If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002.
Please provide a proposed roof plan at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Unless clearly specified otherwise, the base of the development shown on the approved plans is taken to be external ground level, and not a Damp Proof Course or Internal Finished Floor Level. The external ground level is expected to remain consistent before and after construction of the approved development unless specified otherwise on the approved plans.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action if expedient.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Of the works which are not exempt and for which application is required, the works proposed are acceptable for he purposes of health and safety and general management of trees at the school, and will not be harmful to public amenity.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Aceeptable minor repeat maintenance works.Recommendation:Approve.
A1 - Loading
Ventilation to roof in  accordance with BS 5250

PART B - Fire Safety- Existing means of escape not to be made worse Any dormer cheeks within 1.0m of the boundary to have cement based board under any cladding (non-combustible / 30min fire resistant), and 30mins fire resistance from the internal side. Mains operated interlinked smoke detection is required to all landings levels / circulation spaces, installed in accordance with the recommendation of BS5839 - 6 :2019 and A1 :2020. The existing first floor ceiling requires 30min fire resistance. All new elements of the structure require 30mins fire resistance. 60min fire separation is required at Party Walls.  PART C - Site Preparation and Resistance to Contaminants and Moisture If the roof does not incorporate a breathable membrane, it may require cross ventilation. This may involve high and low level ventilation, sizes are dependent upon the roof type and profile. Flat roof dormers will require cross ventilation if a warm deck construction has not been proposed. If a warm deck flat roof is proposed please note a decking and vapour control layer are required below the insulation. PART E - Resistance to the Passage of Sound Internal walls between bedrooms/bathrooms and any adjoining room should incorporate sound insulation. All new separating floors should incorporate sound insulation. Any separating walls with adjacent properties may need upgrading to achieve acoustic reduction. PART F - Ventilation Purge ventilation should be provided to all new habitable rooms to achieve a minimum 4 air changes per hour. This can be achieved with either mechanical extract or openings. Please provide details. Please confirm background ventilation will be provided at a rate of 8,000mm2 to habitable rooms, and 4,000mm2 to bathrooms in accordance with ADS F table 1.7 (copy attached). Please note night latches are no longer considered acceptable for background ventilation. Intermittent mechanical extract should be provided to the following locations and should discharge at the following rates: Bathroom - 15l/s; WC - 6l/s. All extracts should discharge to external air (NB: recirculating fans are not classed as extract); for windowless accommodation intermittent extracts should have a 15-minute overrun. Please confirm all extract fans will be located a maximum 400mm below ceiling level. Extract fans should not exceed the following noise levels; Fans located in bedrooms or living rooms 30dB, fans within kitchens and bathrooms 45dB. PART H - Drainage and Waste Disposal Please provide details of all new, or alterations to existing above ground drainage installations. PART J - Combustion Appliances and Fuel Storage Systems Please clarify the proposed heating to the works and if any flues are proposed as their location is subject to control. Part K - Protection from Falling, Collision and Impact Any glazing in critical locations should be constructed of safety glass. The height, construction and design of guarding and balustrades is controlled and consideration should be given to their design. Staircases are controlled including the rise and going, handrail design, balustrade, headroom, pitch and tapered tread layout. It is advised any proposed design is discussed with us prior to ordering. PART L - Conservation of Fuel and Power Please clarify the proposed insulation types and thicknesses to the roof, floor and walls, the thermal elements should meet or exceed the standard U-Values set out in AD L table 4.2. (copy attached) The walls should be no worse than 0.18 W/M²K, the roof no worse than 0.15W/M²K, and the floors no worse than 0.18W/M²K. All new windows and glazed doors (60%) should achieve a U-Values of at least 1.4W/M²K, and rooflights 2.2 W/M²K. Commissioning, Certification and Information Provision. Please note: All of these items will remain in red until the certificates have been received, on completion of the project. An appropriate BS 7671 electrical installation certificate will be required from an electrician registered with a recognised trade body, such as NICEIC, ECA & NAPIT . An installation certificate is required for any new or altered unvented hot water cylinder, commissioned by a competent installer. An installation certificate is required for any new or altered gas appliance.
Ventilation to roof in  accordance with BS 5250
RBK structural engineers approval.
